text.__SUMMARY__:
Acacia xerophila is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Phyllodineae. It is native to an area in the Goldfields-Esperance region of Western Australia.The shrub typically grows to a height of 0.15 to 1.0 metre (0.5 to 3.3 ft) and produces yellow flowers.
There are two recognised varieties:

Acacia xerophila var. brevior
Acacia xerophila var. xerophila
